imdb.title: Rurôni Kenshin - Meiji kenkaku romantan
imdb.plot: The adventures of a young wandering swordsman who stumbles upon a struggling martial arts school in Meiji era Japan.

episodes.title: The Legend of the Fireflies
episodes.plot: Back at home, Kaoru works to restore the dilapidated dojo, while Kenshin encounters a wise old fisherman who teaches him an important lesson about love.

episodes.title: The Birth of Prince Yahiko
episodes.plot: After stepping in to stop what appears to be a robbery, Kenshin and Kaoru meet a young prince who looks exactly like Yahiko.

episodes.title: Find the Lost Treasure!
episodes.plot: Sanosuke adopts a stray dog, unaware that it holds the key to a criminal gang's plot to blackmail some local officials and gain political control. And when the gang finally tracks him down, Kenshin and Yahiko join Sanosuke to foil their plan.

episodes.title: Kaoru, Ecstatic
episodes.plot: After Kenshin finds a ring inside a catfish, he's persuaded to give it to Kaoru. Thinking it's an engagement ring, Kaoru is sure that he's asking her to get married.

episodes.title: The Gleaming Blade of Legends
episodes.plot: Alerted by Misao, Kenshin and the rest of the Peace Force arrive to help Aoshi find a mysterious killer. Kenshin's investigation uncovers evidence linking the killing to a Christian swordsman and of vengeance that's been foretold.

episodes.title: The Medallion of Destiny
episodes.plot: In an effort to prevent more revenge killings, Kenshin must take on Shogo Amakusa, the Christian warrior known as God's Child.

episodes.title: To the Battlefield of Shimabara
episodes.plot: As Kenshin prepares to honor his promise to stop Shogo Amakusa, he and Sanosuke uncover a secret church that was built when Christian worshipers were forced underground.

episodes.title: Shock of the Rairyu Sen
episodes.plot: When neither Kaoru nor Kenshin can persuade Shogo Amakusa to abandon his plan to advance the Christian cause through violence, the stage for battle is set.

episodes.title: Kaiou's Conspiracy
episodes.plot: Though blinded by his duel with Shogo Amakusa, Kenshin seeks another battle in hopes it will restore his sight.

episodes.title: The Days of Remorse
episodes.plot: Along with the story of his parent's martyrdom, Misao uncovers the truth behind the alleged miracles that deified Shogo Amarusa.

episodes.title: The Sneering Demon
episodes.plot: Sir Kaioh unveils his plan to use Shogo Amarusa's loyal followers to overthrow the government and control Japan himself.

episodes.title: Sanosuke's Tears
episodes.plot: As Kenshin tries to stop the slaughter of the Christians as they march towards martyrdom, Sanosuke is unable to avert the death of Shogo's terminally ill sister.

episodes.title: The Last Crusade
episodes.plot: As Misao and the Dutch consul ask the Army delay to their attack, the sightless Kenshin pressures Shogo to prevent the martyrdom of his followers.

episodes.title: Bon Voyage
episodes.plot: Following Shogo's surrender, Kenshin asks the government not to execute him. As a result, he and his followers are sent into exile in Holland.

episodes.title: Himura Dojo in Shimonoseki?
episodes.plot: When the Peace Force comes across a man posing as Kenshin, everyone else wants the impostor exposed. But Kenshin notes that he's been using his profits to care for a group of orphans.

episodes.title: Crush!
episodes.plot: When Kenshin accidentally loses all their money, the Peace Force must go to work at an inn in order to pay their bill.

episodes.title: Kaishu-Katsu and Kenshin
episodes.plot: Kaoru offers to take on a scholarly young student who's been expelled by his teacher until he learns how to fight.

episodes.title: The Unending Revolution
episodes.plot: As Kaoru continues her training of Daigoro, Kenshin is warned to steer clear of the young man's teacher, Kaishu Katsu.

episodes.title: Conspiracy of the Beniaoi
episodes.plot: Despite Kaishu's determination to free his daughter on his own, Kenshin joins the Peace Force and Daigoro for a rescue.

episodes.title: Kaishu-Katsu's Determination
episodes.plot: Though Daigoro is wounded in the battle, Kenshin and company free Itsuko.

episodes.title: Yutaro Returns
episodes.plot: With his arm nearly healed, Yutaro and his doctor arrive for a visit at the dojo.

episodes.title: The Sanada Ninja Squad
episodes.plot: The notebook of Professor Hans reveals that the elixir might cure every illness and that the Black Knights plan to use it to rule the world.

episodes.title: A Straying Journey
episodes.plot: Using the clues left behind by Dr. Hans, Kenshin and company are led to the hidden shrine that holds the key to the miracle cure.

episodes.title: A Heatwave from Beneath the Earth
episodes.plot: After surviving a fall into a volcano, the Peace Force comes across an injured Sanada Ninja who offers to help battle his former allies.

episodes.title: Schneider's Bet
episodes.plot: After their search leads them to the hidden cure, the leader of the Black Knights makes it clear that he has no intention of honoring his promise to cede control of Japan to the Sanada Ninjas.

episodes.title: The Two Guides
episodes.plot: As he faces off against the Black Knight's leader, Kenshin must rely on his brains and not his sword to win the battle.

episodes.title: To My Angel Misao
episodes.plot: As Aoshi arrives to bring her home, Misao joins Kaoru and some friends for a final shopping spree. However, Sanosuke and Yahiko's efforts to keep an eye on the women lead to them to be mistaken for a pair of thieves.

episodes.title: Feng Shui Surprise Attack!
episodes.plot: Following a series of accidents in town, a master of feng shui blames an imbalance in the Ki, a force which keeps all of nature's other forces in balance.

episodes.title: The Magic of Feng Shui
episodes.plot: As Kenshin learns of a battle between the Wind and Water families for control of the Ki, efforts to build a railroad are exposed as a Water clan plot to control Japan.

episodes.title: Tokyo Under Martial Law
episodes.plot: The Water family's efforts to gain control of the Ki have left Kaoru seriously wounded.

episodes.title: The Enemy Awaits in Senjogahara
episodes.plot: With help from the Wind family's leader, Kenshin saves Kaoru's life. But the Water family's quest to redirect the Ki and gain control of Japan moves ahead as planned.

episodes.title: The Elegy of Wind and Water
episodes.plot: With Kenshin's help, the Wind family derails their rival's plan to redirect the flow of the Ki and ends their effort to dominate Japan.

episodes.title: End of Wanderings
episodes.plot: A VHS only special episode. Also known as Episode 95.

episodes.title: Prelude to the Impending Fight: The Shadow of the Wolf Draws Near
episodes.plot: The brief period of peace of the group is interrupted by the presence of former Shinsengumi captain Hajime Saito.

episodes.title: Strongest Opponent from the Past: Merciless Fangs Strike!
episodes.plot: Sanosuke is beginning to recover from the wounds inflicted by Saito who provokes Kenshin to a duel.

episodes.title: A Devil of Vengeance: Makoto Shishio's Plot
episodes.plot: Kenshin survives the duel, but he finds out that more has to come when a plot about overthrowing the government emerges.

episodes.title: A Wish Unrequited: Kenshin Departs
episodes.plot: Kenshin decides to go to Kyoto and to put an end to the plot of Shishio.

episodes.title: Change Tears to Courage: Kaoru Kamiya's Choice
episodes.plot: Kaoru is deeply depressed since Kenshin left Tokyo. With the help of her friends, Kaoru regains her courage and decides to go to Kyoto and see Kenshin.

episodes.title: For the Title of Strongest: Aoshi's New Conflict
episodes.plot: Aoshi would do anything to defeat Kenshin. He feels he has to prove to the world that the Oniwabanshu are the strongest fighters.

episodes.title: The Girl Bandit: Misao Makimachi's Hidden Side
episodes.plot: The female bandit, whom Kenshin meets in the forest, is a member of the Oniwabanshu. Misao refuses to stop chasing Kenshin, as she believes that he can lead her to them.

episodes.title: Conquered Village: The Grasp of Shishio's Hands
episodes.plot: Along the way to Kyoto, Kenshin and Misao travel to Shingetsu Village and fight some of Shishio's soldiers off.

episodes.title: Across the Boundary Between Edo and Meiji: Kenshin and Shishio Face to Face!
episodes.plot: Kenshin and Senkaku fight at the Shishio's mansion.

episodes.title: Shock! The Reverse-Blade Is Broken: Sojiro's Tenken Verses Kenshin
episodes.plot: Shishio is challenged by Kenshin, but Shishio refuses the duel, saying that Kenshin is weak as a wanderer. Shishio tells Sojiro, his right hand man, to fight Kenshin instead.

episodes.title: Sanosuke's Secret Training: The Challenge of Anji the Destroyer
episodes.plot: Sanosuke gets lost in a forest. He is saved by a monk.

episodes.title: The Creator of the Reverse-Blade Sword: Shakku Arai's Final Swing
episodes.plot: Kenshin and Misao make it to Kyoto. Kenshin goes to see Sekku Arai, who is the son of Shakku Arai, the one who forged the reverse blade sword, in order to replace its broken sword.

episodes.title: A Killer Without Mercy: Fight to the Death Against the Cho of the Juppongatana
episodes.plot: Kenshin finds that Cho has kidnapped baby Iori in order to obtain the final masterpiece of Shakku for himself. Kenshin is forced to choose between keeping his vow not to kill and saving the baby.

episodes.title: The Ultimate Technique of the Hiten-Mitsurugi Style: Reunion with a Mentor, Seijuro Hiko
episodes.plot: Kenshin finds his master Seijuro Hiko living as a potter near Kyoto, but Hiko is initially unwilling to take Kenshin back because he joined the revolution.

episodes.title: The Formation of an Alliance: The Day When Aoshi Joins with Shishio
episodes.plot: Okina doesn't allow Aoshi to continue as the leader of the Oniwabanshu due to his demonic desire to kill Kenshin. Desperate Misao tries to stop the confrontation at the temple between the two.

episodes.title: Between Life and Death: Master the Ultimate Technique, Amakakeru Ryu No Hikameki!
episodes.plot: While training, Kenshin finally proves himself worthy of learning the final technique from his master, Seijuro Hiko.

episodes.title: A Decisive Battle Like Violent Waters: The Strongest Troop Juppongatana
episodes.plot: The Ten Swords have gathered in the temple of Shishio in Kyoto and are ready to commence their grand plan.

episodes.title: As If to Fly: Stop the Launch of the Battleship Purgatory!
episodes.plot: Kenshin, Sanosuke and Saito go to Osaka to stop Shishio and his men.

episodes.title: Purgatory Bursts Into Flames: The Destiny of Makoto Shishio
episodes.plot: Kenshin and Sanosuke try stop Shishio's battleship Purgatory from destroying Kyoto.

episodes.title: Crash! The Lethal Punch, Futae No Kiwami: The Fist of Sonosuke Screams!
episodes.plot: Kenshin, Sanosuke and Saito journey to Mount Hiei at the Shrine of the Six Arches to settle the score with Shishio.

episodes.title: Reborn to Salvation: The Beginning of Anji's New Life
episodes.plot: Sanosuke and Anji continue their duel. Kenshin and Saito continue on ahead to fight Usui Uonuma, the second challenger.

episodes.title: The Wolf Destroys the Eye of the Heart: The Fierce Attack of the Zero Stance Gatotsu
episodes.plot: Usui confronts Saito while the others go to Shishio's mansion.

episodes.title: The Promised Time Has Come: Aoshi and Kenshin Fight Again
episodes.plot: Aoshi and Kenshin fight again, to claim the title of the strongest.

episodes.title: Wake Up Now! Ignore Your Wounds and Fight to the Finish
episodes.plot: After emerging victorious, Kenshin and Sanosuke advance to the next battle.

episodes.title: To Make a Miracle: The Battle at the Aoiya
episodes.plot: Kaoru, Yahiko and Misao are to battle against Kamatari Honjo, Henya Kariwa, and Iwanbo.

episodes.title: The Giant Versus Superman: Like an Arrow Shot at a Time of Despair
episodes.plot: The inn is safe from harm, but Kenshin still has to fight Sojiro in order to fight Shishio himself.

episodes.title: Hiten Versus Shukuchi
episodes.plot: Kenshin and Sojiro have their second duel, since the one in Shingetsu Village was never finished.

episodes.title: The Tragedy of a Stormy Night
episodes.plot: The past of Sojiro and how Shishio saved him.

episodes.title: A Duel with an Extreme Moment
episodes.plot: Sojiro and Kenshin fight each other and full strength.

episodes.title: Two Men at the End of an Era
episodes.plot: Yumi guides Kenshin and Sanosuke to the top of the Inferno Arena where Shishio himself is waiting.

episodes.title: The Age Chooses Shishio?
episodes.plot: Shisio fights Kenshin and his allies.

episodes.title: Not Out of Luck!
episodes.plot: The epic battle between Shishio and Kenshin with his allies continues .

episodes.title: The Man Who Is Chosen for Victory
episodes.plot: The battle ends, but Hoji, refusing to accept Shishio's defeat, attempts to destroy the Inferno Arena to kill everybody.

episodes.title: The Juppongatana Who Remain Aka the Choice for Life
episodes.plot: The arena is on fire and only a few escape. Meanwhile, Shishio, Yumi and Hoji gather in the underworld and plot an ambush.

episodes.title: Kyoto, the Engraved Memory
episodes.plot: Finally, the group gets on the train to Tokyo where their dojo is.

episodes.title: Densetsu no Bikenshi... Ai Yue ni Tatakau Otoko
episodes.plot: Young Kaoru, heiress of a respectful Döjö in Meji-Era Japan, meet a wandering ("rurouni"), master-less samurai. She confronts him, as she thought he is the infamous killer "Battousai", but he saves her life from the one who's calling himself "Battousai" and it's making a bad reputation of Kaoru's deceased father's Döjö.

episodes.title: Kid Samurai: A Big Ordeal and a New Student
episodes.plot: "Rurouni" Kenshin and Kaoru meet young orphan Yahiko, who is forced to steal to pay a debt to the Yakuzas.

episodes.title: Swordsman of Sorrow: The Man Who Slays His Past
episodes.plot: The Imperial Police are looking for Himura Kenshin at Kaoru's dojo. Kenshin is out, so Kaoru sent Yahiko to town to warn him. Soon they will be faced with violent policemen and Kenshin will meet again with someone from his past.

episodes.title: Bad! Introducing Sanosuke, the Fighter-for-Hire
episodes.plot: During lunch at a restaurant, Kenshin and the group faces three drunken bandits, calling themselves "pro-democracy". They soon prove their double-standard, threatening innocent people. A young man appears and defeat the men. Later he is introduced as a "fighter-for-hire", known as "Zanza", and he will be offered to fight against Kenshin under contract.

episodes.title: The Reversed-Blade Sword vs. The Zanbatou: Beyond the Battle
episodes.plot: The young man known as "Zanza" will finally have his match against Kenshin. "Zanza" is no ordinary fighter, he's the only one who mastered the use of the giant sword "Zanbatou". He's also an orphan, who was under Captain Sagara teachings, a leader of the "Sekihötai". He holds a huge resent against the "Imperialists", which he sees represented in the figure of "hitokiri battousai", Kenshin Himura.

episodes.title: The Appearance of Kurogasa: Visitor from the Shadows
episodes.plot: A rogue killer from the Revolution is on the loose, systematically killing officials of the new Meiji government. The police come to Kenshin and ask for his help as all efforts to apprehend this criminal have ended in failure.

episodes.title: Deathmatch Under the Moon: Protect the One You Love
episodes.plot: Jin-e and Kenshin fight to the death with Kaoru's life on the line.

episodes.title: A New Battle! The Mysterious Beauty from Nowhere
episodes.plot: A mysterious woman shows up and requests Kenshin's help. She is being pursued by the Oniwabanshuu, an elite group of ninja that used to protect the Edo castle.

episodes.title: The Strongest Group of Ninjas
episodes.plot: Takeda takes Megumi away by threatening the people at the dojo. Sanosuke convinces her to come back, but she is captured.

episodes.title: Aoshi: Someone So Beautiful It's Frightening
episodes.plot: The group goes to retrieve Megumi, but the ninjas stand in their way. Kenshin and Sanosuke confront commander Aoshi.

episodes.title: Farewell, the Strongest Men: The Clash of Light and Shadow
episodes.plot: After the fight between Kenshin and Aoshi, Megumi tries to kill herself for her past mistakes.

episodes.title: The Birth of a Boy Swordsman: The Battle of First Apprentice Yahiko
episodes.plot: Yahiko meets a cute girl who works at the Akabeko restaurant. She is being forced into helping a group of thugs to steal from the restaurant, and Yahiko decides to help her by himself.

episodes.title: Going for the Grand Championship You Can Do It! Toramaru's Dosukoi Journey
episodes.plot: Kaoru takes in Toramaru, a sumo wrestler.

episodes.title: To Save a Small Life! Challenge! Doctor Megumi!
episodes.plot: A sick girl is put in a life threatening situation because of her parents who pay money to a shaman to heal her instead of requesting the help of doctor Megumi.

episodes.title: Assassination Group of Fire the Operation Starts! The Terrorist Group Jinpu Tai
episodes.plot: The Jinpu squad is performing vigilante assassinations. Kenshin and Sano try to stop them.

episodes.title: A Promise from the Heart Take a Pledge! The Hidden Sword Technique, Shiden No Tachi!
episodes.plot: Toma, the Jinpu leader, fights against Kenshin after his group was defeated.

episodes.title: Blast to Your Dream. The Adventure of Marimo the Flying Bullet
episodes.plot: The group goes to the circus where they discover a plot to sabotage the show.

episodes.title: Get Back the Reverse-Blade Sword Run! Yahiko, Bring the Sakabatou Back!
episodes.plot: Hiruma Gohei returns and hires the Onizaki brothers to kill Kenshin.

episodes.title: Raijuuta's Desire. Vision of a Forbidden Empire
episodes.plot: A wealthy boy falls under the influence of Raijuta, who intends to create a kingdom with his warriors.

episodes.title: Shinko Ryu's Revived! Show of Evil, Ultimate Killing Technique!
episodes.plot: The military attacks Raijuto and his gang.

episodes.title: Dissolution of a Nightmare Destruction of a Nightmare
episodes.plot: Kenshin stops the battle by challenging Raijuta to a one on one battle.

episodes.title: Danger on a Runaway Locomotive Surprise Incident on a Runaway Locomotive
episodes.plot: The group takes a train trip to Yokohama for fun.

episodes.title: Sanosukes Betrayal the Fateful Reunion
episodes.plot: Sanosuke discovers a portrait of his former captain Sagara and plans a revenge.

episodes.title: Midnight Battle: Kenshin Versus Sanosuke Revisited
episodes.plot: Sanosuke throws a party at the Kamiya Dojo. But others are his intentions.

episodes.title: The Crimson Pirate the Red Pirate: Kenshin and Kaoru Separated
episodes.plot: To make money for the dojo, Kaoru gets a job on a boat cruise and the boys sign up for a team of warriors who must defeat the Kairyu pirates.

episodes.title: Lightning Incarnate Shura, the Mysterious Female Pirate
episodes.plot: Shura, the pirate leader, takes Kenshin to the Kairyu Island as a prisoner where a mutiny is arising.

episodes.title: Burn, Island of Terror! The Red Pirate: Conclusion
episodes.plot: Kenshin must help Shura to end the mutiny.
